Liver CT Analysis

Quantitative analysis pipeline for abdominal CT scans from hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) patients.

What is Liver CT Analysis?

CT imaging is the primary diagnostic tool for hepatocellular carcinoma. This pipeline provides standardized, reproducible quantitative analysis of liver CT scans for research and clinical assessment.

Clinical Applications

  • Tumor Assessment: Quantitative measurement of liver lesions
  • HCC Diagnosis: Standardized imaging analysis for hepatocellular carcinoma
  • Treatment Monitoring: Track tumor response to therapy
  • Research Studies: Reproducible analysis for clinical trials
  • Quality Control: Automated QC for imaging studies

Pipeline Workflow

  1. Image Import: Load CT scan data (DICOM format)
  2. Quality Control: Automated QC checks on imaging data
  3. Quantitative Analysis: Measure tumor characteristics
  4. Report Generation: Comprehensive analysis report

Key Features

  • Standardized Protocol: Consistent analysis across studies
  • Reproducible Results: Containerized workflow ensures reproducibility
  • Automated QC: Quality control for imaging data
  • Research-Ready: Outputs formatted for statistical analysis

Scientific Background

Hepatocellular Carcinoma (HCC) is the most common primary liver cancer and a leading cause of cancer-related deaths worldwide. CT imaging is critical for diagnosis, staging, and treatment monitoring.

Input Requirements

  • CT Scans: Abdominal CT imaging data (DICOM format)
  • Metadata: Patient identifiers and scan parameters

Expected Outputs

  • Quantitative Measurements: Tumor size, density, enhancement patterns
  • QC Reports: Image quality metrics
  • Analysis Summary: Comprehensive results report

Perfect for: HCC Research • Medical Imaging • Clinical Trials • Tumor Assessment • Diagnostic Studies
